comments: There isn\'t anything positive to say about Dr. Somani. She is very negative and will discourage you from learning. Instead of teaching, she is more focused on being a dictator. I pity the fool that has to take her class. Steer clear, very clear. She has zero passion for teaching. She\'s hell on earth - words cannot explain. x_x

Professor Somani was the professor I learned the most from in the journalism department. She has high expectations for her students, but wants you to succeed and cares deeply about each student. I am now a news producer and I apply the skills she taught me in Rockbridge Report every single day at work. Excellent, smart and caring professor.

I enjoyed Prof. Somani as a teacher and mentor. A print journalism major, I needed to learn the broadcast skills to supplement my knowledge. What I learned in her classroom is vital to my day-to-day work now. A tough grader with high expectations for her students. But she teaches you the skills/integrity you need to succeed in a journalism career.

Professor Somani is one of the best (albeit hardest) professors I\'ve had at W&L. Yes, she is demanding and yes, she is not one to coddle but let\'s be honest: that\'s the reality of a real-life broadcast newsroom. If you put in the effort, she\'ll reward you with a rich understanding of journalism and an invested interest in seeing you succeed.

I learned more about not angering Prof. Somani than I did about reporting. I stopped asking questions after she took off points on assignments based on those questions, and rather just hoped she wouldn\'t notice I hadn\'t known! She rarely did. Her anxiety is unbearable and contagious. I know I\'ll have a bad boss in the jworld, but don\'t need her now

Unless you are able to figure out exactly what she wants from Day 1 of class, I would steer clear. I seriously considered not becoming a Journalism major because of this class, mostly because of her. I would steer clear of her as much as possible.

I would equate her to China\'s One Child law - while she has spruced up the Rockbridge Report her very presence in Reid Hall has wiped out an entire generation of potential J-majors. Sadly, it\'s impossible not to be pejorative in warning would-be majors how offensive, objective, anxious, childish and cantankerous she is. Will ruin your term.

Unless you love journalism, steer clear. While Professor Somani has somewhat improved the Reid Hall program, her social awkwardness and inability to control her anxiety level leads to classroom disasters, especially during the weekly Thursday news show.
Very unclear about her expectations, arbitrary grader, easily offended, and just overall an unpleasant professor. Avoid this one.
She\'s fine unless you\'re her student. A fair grader overall, but very tough. She has an anxiety level that\'s contagious, but so long as you keep things in perspective you should be alright.

One of the most useless classes I\'ve ever taken. She could have done a lot more with the class because it\'s her specialty. I didn\'t learn anything. She forced us to watch her documentary and to write a response on it. She is not at all objective and unfair.
